content: work in row begin with dark blue yarn 1 chain 37 2 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch double_crochet x17 slip_stitch f/o leaving a tail for sewing eyes make 2 begin with tan/yellow yarn 1 mr6 f/o leaving a tail for sewing eyeballs make 2 make a loose knot in the center of a 6 piece of dark blue yarn add one or two more knots over top of the first knot depending on the size of the eyeball you want i suggest a total of 2 knots see photo on right assembly 3 sew chin onto the bottom of the dodogama s head your row should run vertically from the tip of the nose down to the base of the neck see photos stuff before closing off sew large spots across the top of the chin see photos for placement sew small spots in columns of 2 below the large spots see photos for placement sew spikes lengthwise down the body of the dodogama mine started in row 6 of the head and ended row 18 of the tail tie the eyeballs onto the eyes by threading the tails on each side of the knot through opposite stitches of the mr6 from the eyeballs and tying the ends together using the tail from the eyes sew each completed eye to the dodogama s face mine landed on row 5-8 of the head about 7 stitches apart see photos for placement
